Refresh access token using refresh token
Invalidate all tokens for the current user
Creates a new comment for a specific release.

requestBody.description: The comment creation data containing release ID and comment text.

400.description: If the model is invalid or release doesn't exist

401.description: If the user is not authenticated

get.summary: Retrieves a specific comment by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the comment to retrieve.

404.description: If the comment is not found

401.description: If the user is not authenticated

put.summary: Updates an existing comment's text content.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the comment to update.

401.description: If the user is not authenticated

403.description: If the user is not authorized to update this comment

404.description: If the comment is not found

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the comment to delete.

401.description: If the user is not authenticated

get.summary: Retrieves detailed information about a specific file list

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file list

delete.summary: Removes a file list submission. Only the submitter or admin can remove submissions.

parameters.name: submissionId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the submission to remove

403.description: Not authorized to remove this submission

get.summary: Retrieves file information with format determined by Accept header

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file

406.description: Requested format not available for this file type

delete.summary: Deletes a specific file and its associated physical file. Requires Admin role.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file to delete

get.summary: Returns the top users ordered by the amount of accepted file submissions.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of entries to return (default: 100, max: 500).

parameters.name: dryRun
parameters.description: If true, shows what changes would be made without applying them

post.summary: Reset stuck enhancement statuses from InProgress to Waiting

parameters.name: minutesThreshold
parameters.description: Reset statuses that have been InProgress for more than this many minutes (default: 5)

parameters.name: dryRun
parameters.description: If true, shows what would be reset without applying changes

get.summary: Get current configuration information
Get overall performance overview including endpoint and database metrics
Get detailed endpoint performance metrics
Get all endpoint performance metrics with pagination and sorting
Get database performance metrics including slow and frequent queries
Get slowest database queries
Get most frequently executed database queries
Get performance trends for a specific endpoint over time
Get time series performance data for charting
Get slowest individual requests for a specific endpoint
Get error requests for a specific endpoint
Search for products with filtering and pagination
Get detailed information about a specific product including enhancement statuses
Get top releases for a specific product, sorted by MediaInfo file count
Get all products with basic information (for admin/debugging purposes)
Retrieves all release groups.
Searches release groups by name for autocomplete functionality.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query to match against release group names.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return (default: 10).

get.summary: Retrieves a paginated list of releases with optional filtering.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Optional search term for release name or group.

parameters.name: releaseGroupIds
parameters.description: Optional filter by release group IDs.

parameters.name: tagTypes
parameters.description: Optional filter by file tag types.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: Optional filter by product ID to show releases for a specific product.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort field: createdAt, name, fileCount, commentCount (default: createdAt).

post.summary: Creates a new release without submitting a file along. Requires admin role.

get.summary: Retrieves detailed information about a specific release by ID.

delete.summary: Deletes a release by ID. Requires admin role.

get.summary: Retrieves files associated with a release. Optionally filter by file type.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Optional file type filter (NFO or MediaInfo).

get.summary: Retrieves the highest-scoring file of the specified type for a release.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The file type to retrieve (NFO or MediaInfo).

parameters.name: raw
parameters.description: If true, return the raw file contents instead of structured JSON.

parameters.name: fallback
parameters.description: If true, attempt to fallback to the other file type if the specified type is not found.

get.summary: Retrieves the highest-scoring file of the specified type for a release identified by its name.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The file type to retrieve (NFO or MediaInfo).

parameters.name: raw
parameters.description: If true, return the raw file contents instead of structured JSON.

parameters.name: fallback
parameters.description: If true, attempt to fallback to the other file type if the specified type is not found.

post.summary: Submits a new file (NFO or MediaInfo) for a release.

ReleaseName.description: Name of the release being created or linked to.

OriginalFileName.description: The original filename as present on the submitter's system (required for NFO files).

FileHash.description: SHA-256 hash of the main file (e.g. the mkv file, not the nfo file) (optional).

delete.summary: Removes an alias from a release

get.summary: Retrieves file lists for a specific release
Retrieves the highest-scoring (most trusted) file list for a release.
Retrieves the highest-scoring (most trusted) file list for a release identified by its name.

post.summary:
Submits a new file list for a release by release name
Returns 202 Accepted as processing may continue in the background.

get.summary: Retrieves paginated submissions for a specific user

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user ID to get submissions for

403.description: Not authorized to view this user's submissions

delete.summary: Removes a submission (file or file list) and updates trust scores accordingly. Users can remove their own submissions, admins can remove any.

403.description: Not authorized to remove this submission

get.summary: Get current user's profile
Get all users with pagination (admin only)
Get user by ID

put.summary: Update user profile. Requires authentication (self or admin).

post.summary: Change user password. Requires authentication (self or admin).
Generate or refresh API key for the user (self or admin).

400.description: If the application data is invalid.

500.description: If there was an internal server error.

get.summary: Retrieves a paginated list of all user applications. Requires admin role.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of items per page (max 100).

400.description: If the pagination parameters are invalid.

401.description: If the user is not authenticated.

403.description: If the user is not authorized as an admin.

get.summary: Retrieves a specific user application by ID. Requires admin role.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application to retrieve.

401.description: If the user is not authenticated.

403.description: If the user is not authorized to view this application.

404.description: If the application is not found.

put.summary: Reviews a user application and updates its status. Requires admin role.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application to review.

requestBody.description: The review data including status and comments.

400.description: If the review data is invalid.

401.description: If the user is not authenticated.

403.description: If the user is not authorized as an admin.

404.description: If the application is not found.

500.description: If there was an internal server error.

ProcessingServiceType.description:
Unified enum for all processing service types across the system.
Handles File processing, Release processing, and Product enhancement services.
Replaces the entity-specific approach with a unified processing system.

serviceName.description: Human-readable name of the service type

lastAttempted.description: When this processing step was last attempted (successful or failed)

lastSuccessful.description: When this processing step was last completed successfully

errorMessage.description: Error message if the last attempt failed, null if successful

createdAt.description: When the status record was created

updatedAt.description: When the status record was last updated

ProcessingStatusDto.description: Represents the processing status for a specific service type (unified for all entity types)

ProcessingStepStatus.description:
Represents the status of an individual processing step for a file.
Each processing step (LLM analysis, virus scanning, etc.) can have its own independent status.

processingStatuses.description: Processing statuses for all configured services
